author: deni64k
content:
Hi all! I got a questions about light nodes (geth) and the Great Merge.
I see `GetPayloadV1` is the only RPC call unsupported by les. Is it impossible to implement or will be implemented later? I can imagine `GetPayloadV1` requires mempool only so it should be doable, but I might be easily mistaken?
https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/master/les/catalyst/api.go#L99-L102=

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: LES is still on some older version of the engine api

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Since the engine api changed so rapidly I opted to not update LES for it

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: But yes we can not have GetPayloadV1 in LES, not because of the txpool, but because creating a block requires the state (which is not available on a light nocde)

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: With PBS it might be possible to implement GetPayload on a light node in the future

author: butta
content: fyi there will be support for sepolia from beaconcha.in

author: dirigible6945
content: ETH devs, when looking to the future, should be mindful of the network hashrate. The price action has been very brutal, and have lost quite a lot over the last two weeks.

author: dirigible6945
content: So when the mainnet merge is to come, may need to consider setting a shorter TTD than you normally would lest the delay from even further hashrate drops becomes a confounding factor. I know Tim has talked about this before.

author: dirigible6945
content: Have we considered increasing the block rewards to keep the hashrate high?

author: dirigible6945
content: I don't know how naive this sounds, but say scaling the block rewards with bomb delay times so as to encourage consistent hashrate in the late Aug - early Oct window.

author: ravensslayer
content: or a big reward for mining the TRANSITION_BLOCK

author: timbeiko
content: There is nothing "special" about the transition block, nor is there logic in the issuance calculations to identify it

author: timbeiko
content: there can be many candidate transition blocks, and having a larger reward for it will just mean a ton of uncles right at the merge
